questions.question: Which of the following elements are commonly detected using Lassaigne’s test?

explanations.b: Lassaigne’s test detects nitrogen, sulfur, and halogens by converting them into water-soluble ionic compounds.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of fusing the organic compound with sodium in Lassaigne’s test?

answers.b: To convert elements into detectable forms

explanations.b: The sodium fusion converts covalently bonded elements (N, S, halogens) into ionic, water-soluble forms like NaCN, Na₂S, and NaX
